comment: Lectures can be a bit hard to stay focused. The lectures are very slow paced. All tests were open note but he said he was trying it out so may not be that way for all classes. Reading textbook will help you a lot. Picky grader, will count things wrong for leaving out something as simple as a dash in your answer. Tests are easy if you do the work.

Professor King is one of the best professors out there. He's caring, respectful, always willing to listen and assist. He is clear in the syllabus and if you need an extension or have something going on, communicate! He will work with you! He also gives clear instructions and feedback on discussion boards and assignments.

Professor King is great! When I went to class he was very interesting and incredibly knowledgeable in the topics he taught. Attendance isn't required and tests are online an open note. As long as you score well on those and do the homework which is through the textbook it should be an easy A.

Prof King is one of the nicest professors i have had. He makes his lectures intresting. A lot of hw 73 assignments to be accurate but most of the homeworks have a average of 5 questions so not too bad. Hw is worth 45% tests are worth 55% i would take him if u want a free A tests online no lockdown no camera and he is very accesible outside of class

Awkward dude. Hard to listen to him a bit because he's a bit socially awkward and talks slow. Easy class though, tests without lockdown which are open note. Claims attendance isn't mandatory but he never posts any of the lectures and says you should be in class for the information otherwise you won't get it. Easy class though.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He is by far my favorite professor I have had. He is very sweet and nerdy. His tests are online and open book and note. He does not post powerpoints but the textbook has everything he talks about in it. He makes the class go by fast and I learn a lot of interesting facts about criminal justice that other professors do not teach. LOVE HIM!

Mr. King is super chill and the homework is really easy and only takes about 30-45 minutes to do. His test are OPEN NOTE and ONLINE. Attendance isn't mandatory but his lectures are entertaining and not boring. Unless he changes his teaching style I would recommend taking his class.

I took this professor for profile of the serial offender. Professor King is awesome! Super kind professor and is not tough on grading, just show up to class, he only takes attendance once a week for my class!

Great Professor! He's a little goofy but in a good way. Makes learning easy and provides many real-world examples/stories that keep me personally engaged. Kahoot reviews that are super helpful for the exams, and he gives out a lot of bonus points. Literally the only class I've ever looked forward to going to. Would recommend taking his course!

Every week his lectures would include a Kahoot review which was nice. Lectures can be entertaining at times. Homework is a quick discussion post. One thing I noticed is that the tests had usually small facts rather than general knowledge.

Nice and easy class instructed by a sweet guy. He's super accommodating to sickness and helps you get caught up. Attendance is really important because there are assignments you can only complete in person, but very easy class otherwise.

Dr. King was a great professor! His lectures can be a little boring on some units but other units they were really interesting with the different videos and ideas he puts in his presentations. Each week you have a discussion board and a Kahoot but other than that you really don't have any work outside of class. Would absolutely take him again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Inspirational

comment: Very kind and accommodating professor. I learned a lot from his class and felt very supported.

The GOAT of teaching. I recommend him highly for Criminal Justice. Super chill guy and always teaches class with enthusiasm. I always know what to expect with due dates, everything assignment wise is super straightforward.

Exam was open note and he takes attendance on Wednesdays for a grade via Kahoots over that weeks lectures. His only grades outside of that are discussion questions that aren't hard at all, and he's lenient if you forget about it. Very nice and understanding guy. Power Points are a bit of a drag but it's still very easy and he ads in videos to watch

I had professor King for Foundations of Criminal Justice and he was amazing, very kind professor. The class is also really easy, the only assignments are one discussion post each week and a Kahoot. The midterm was online and open notes.  Overall it's a great class and I would definitely take King again if he taught any other course.
